intro: Oncostemum ankifiense, commonly known as the Ankifiense Oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
